text: Learn about the situation from Black Swan

title: Mission Description
content: Black Swan reveals a bone-chilling truth to you: It turned out the entire Express Crew, as well as everyone inPenacony, lost their lives in their battle againstSunday. There were no survivors.However, there is still a chance to turn this around. The Memokeeper points out that there is a fatal flaw in the story that you experienced. Behind this fatal flaw lies a glimmer of hope.Now, you have seen through the illusion ofEna's Dream... However, if you wish to awaken everyone in Asdana, you will need far more people on your side...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission The Sun Also Rises.mp4

speaker: Black Swan
line: Well, let's start with the conclusion â€” The Crew was defeated in the battle against Sunday. Everyone in Penacony failed, and no one survived .

speaker: Black Swan
line: But don't panic. The truth, as horrifying as it may be, is not yet irreversible. There's still a glimmer of hope, and that's why I'm here.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Next, I'll use this empty light cone that carries all your memories to relive everything that happened before. And when this story reaches its end, I'm sure someone as clever as you will notice that...

speaker: Black Swan
line: There's a major flaw in the story you have experienced, yet within that flaw lies a glimmer of hope.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Are you ready for it?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Do you remember everything? When the clock turned back, the Express started a warp jump, sending you to a strange dream. You were bewildered back then, and then a Galaxy Ranger named Acheron showed you a way out.

speaker: Black Swan
line: When you arrived at The Reverie Hotel, you met the doorman Misha and had a confrontation with Aventurine, an IPC representative. Thankfully, Acheron appeared again and helped you.

speaker: Black Swan
line: After that, you saved Firefly and explored Penacony together. During the tour, you ran into Sparkle disguised as Sampo and accidentally entered a child's dream.

speaker: Black Swan
line: There, I rescued both of you from " Death ," but Firefly didn't return to reality. She realized the truth and tried to involve you in her plan, but that resulted in an accidental "death." Even more unsettling, you soon encountered another "murder."

speaker: Black Swan
line: The two cases of "death" prompted you to investigate the truth behind the sweet dream. Despite your efforts to gather information about the two victims, you didn't make much progress. But you did learn about the Watchmaker from Gallagher.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Meanwhile, Aventurine was secretly carrying out his scheme, in which you were one of the pawns. In the midst of a fierce battle, Acheron revealed her true identity as an Emanator of the Nihility and unsheathed her sword.

speaker: Black Swan
line: That strike foiled Aventurine's plan and opened a passage between the sweet dream and the original Memory Zone. Upon your arrival at Dreamflux Reef, you learned the truth that "Death" was actually "Dormancy" , as well as the truth about the Dreamscape, the Stellaron, and the bellboy, Misha.

speaker: Black Swan
line: You split up with Sunday and Robin, looking for a way to seal the Stellaron. However, it turned out that Sunday and the Dreammaster had their own hidden agenda, and you had to engage in an ultimate duel on the stage of the Charmony Festival.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Finally, the story reached its conclusion. You emerged victorious, with the Trailblaze triumphing over the Order and Penacony embracing a bright and peaceful future...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission The Sun Also Rises.mp4

speaker: Black Swan
line: This marks the end of the thrilling journey in Penacony. I'm sure you've already noticed something unusual, haven't you?

speaker: Black Swan
line: The major flaw , which contradicts all the known information, hides in this story...

text: My first encounter with Misha at the hotel...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Heh, little Misha... or should I call him the Watchmaker?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: He is only a segment of memory in a dream bubble, but his ambition for the Trailblaze led him to leave the bubble and embark on a grand adventure in Penacony...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: While Misha is a rather special Memory Zone Meme, and he was granted power by the Trailblaze... there's still one thing that he shouldn't be able to doâ€”

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: ... A life born in the Memory Zone could never manifest in reality . So, why did he appear in The Reverie Hotel in reality?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: The answer is simple â€” He is the one fatal flaw that contradicts all our known information. This means that you, who wholeheartedly believe in this memory...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Are still trapped in the Dreamscape at this very moment .

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Wake up, (Trailblazer). Break free from this eternal dream and return to the real world. We'll find our answers there.

text: I was attacked by Sparkle disguised as Sampo...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Sparkle â€” yes, Sparkle, the most enigmatic and elusive character in the entire story. But unfortunately, she was the first to uncover the truth, and she did purposefully attack you to create confusion.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: By the way, she left me a message to pass on to you. "Always make sure you can distinguish reality from imagination."

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Is that a clue, you may wonder? I'm not sure, although I'm pretty sure that the fatal flaw has nothing to do with that Masked Fool.

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: The fake deaths of Firefly and Robin...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Well, although the fake "deaths" of those two ladies don't align with our initial assumptions, this fact itself doesn't contradict the information we have so far.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: I'll go ahead and eliminate that incorrect answer for you. So, what is the fatal flaw ?

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: Acheron unsheathed her sword and revealed the power of the Nihility...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: Are you suggesting that the sleeping and shapeless never bestows its gaze upon anyone, and thus no one can truly possess the power of the Nihility?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: That's a very astute guess, but unfortunately, Acheron did progress further down the Path of the Nihility. Her unwavering belief in liberating the world from the grasp of Paths surpasses the capabilities of ordinary humans.

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: I'll discard that incorrect answer for you. Take your time and think it through â€” What is the fatal flaw ?

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: "Death" is the disguise of "Dormancy"...

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: It's true that Gallagher is a History Fictionologist, but he didn't lie in this matter. In addition, "death" and "dormancy" do arise from the same concept, don't they?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: This is not the fatal flaw in your adventure. Take your time and think it through.

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Pom-Pom
children.line: The train is about to make the jump!

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Teleports toThe Reverie (Dreamscape))

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ (Back in this familiar room...)

speaker: Black Swan
line: This way, darling.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Acheron
line: Not another one...

speaker: Acheron
line: Thank you so much, Black Swan.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Finally, I can breathe a sigh of relief.

text: What happened?
What is this place?
The deja vu is strong with this scene...

speaker: Acheron
line: I understand you must be confused, and we'll do our best to shed light on the situation. However, before that, it's essential to know that...

speaker: Acheron
line: This place is the rift between dream and reality. A place reserved only for those who have awakened from Ena's dream .

speaker: Black Swan
line: Do you remember Sunday's ambitious plan? He intended to harness the power of the Stellaron , the collective will of over 100,000 Oak Family members, and the desires of everyone in Penacony to usurp the Harmony and restore the Order .

speaker: Acheron
line: Unfortunately, it didn't stop there. From the early days of our journey into Asdana, we were already affected by the Stellaron. That strange Dreamscape where we met... Maybe it was a sign that your thoughts were beginning to drift away.

text: All of this is just a dream?
Did I fall asleep on the Express ?
I'm now back at the beginning of the story?

speaker: Acheron
line: I don't think... the goal of the Order was to put everyone into a deep sleep. Quite the contrary â€” they used the Stellaron to catalyze the leakage of Asdana's memoria into the material world, allowing the Dreamscape to blend with reality.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...And that included a lot of memoria from the Beyond the Sky Choir . As time came and went, the dreams eventually became indistinguishable from reality, and reality became an illusion. People think they are awake, but their spirits have long since stepped into the temple of Order.

speaker: Black Swan
line: This is what makes Ena's Dream so powerful. In this paradise governed by the Order, everyone indulges in their delightful dreams and lives happily ever after.

speaker: Black Swan
line: I believe what you experienced in the sweet dream, except for that flaw, was real. Only in this way could you reach the destination, lifting the crisis in Penacony and embarking on your next trailblazing expedition.

speaker: Black Swan
line: If it wasn't for Acheron's plan, we might have been trapped in this dream forever.

speaker: Acheron
line: Fortunately, while the Path of the Order governs all things, it can't affect the Nihility . I came to realize this when the Dreammaster tried to expel me at any cost.

speaker: Black Swan
line: This is also why you felt a sense of peculiarity when traveling with her.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Well, I'm not as fortunate as she is. Even if I'm a Memokeeper, I was still influenced by the power of the Order and fell into hallucinations.

speaker: Black Swan
line: However, thanks to your memories, now we still have a chance to turn the tide.

speaker: Acheron
line: For mortals, even if they possess the great power of a Path, they can't create a flawless world like Gods do.

speaker: Acheron
line: That's why there was a flaw in your dream. In other words, once you have realized the world is not real, you'll have a chance to break free from the dream.

speaker: Black Swan
line: The flaw in your dream lies within Misha , who could have never appeared in reality. When I turned the pages of your memories, I realized that I was in an illusion, too.

text: We still have a fighting chance.
So, we lost...
Didn't expect it all comes back to Misha...

speaker: Acheron
line: Now Sunday has usurped the power of the Harmonious Choir through the Charmony Festival. Asdana has thus fallen into Ena's Dream, transforming everyone equally into the notes of the Aeon .

speaker: Acheron
line: Failure doesn't mean weakness. Only the strong can gather the will to resist the Order and try to break free.

speaker: Acheron
line: We still have a chance, though. To make it happen... please, Black Swan, guide us to those with a strong will.

text: Go to the Lobby and meet with everyone

speaker: Black Swan
line: Alright, please come with me.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ These people are...?

speaker: Acheron
line: They're the ones who accept Ena's Dream and indulge in their happy illusions...

speaker: Acheron
line: We have no means to wake them up now. Not even your clockwork will do the trick.

speaker: Acheron
line: However, there are still other things we can do. Let's keep going.

text: (Talk to One Lost in a Dream, optional)

children.text: (One of the following will be displayed at random)
Single-minded, this person dives into the dreamscape, having not the slightest reaction to your arrival.
Their eyes are dulled but their lips curl up at the edges, as though transfixed in overwhelming joy.
Their eyes simply droop as they giggle like a fool at only god knows what.
The spark has completely gone from their eyes, replaced by a colossal mania.
They are so immersed in the maniacal fantasy that they completely fail to notice your very existence.

text: Activate Clockwork
Leave.
(Try to tune One Lost in a Dream fromSatisfied)
"Welcome to the Paradise!"
(After trying to tune One Lost in a Dream)

children.text: (One of the following will be displayed at random)
Your "clockwork" doesn't seem to be working anymore.
Your "clockwork" is unable to point this person in the right direction.
Your "clockwork" has no sway on them whatsoever.
Looks like there's no way to rouse this person from their slumber for now â€” not even with your "clockwork."

text: (Floating words)
This is the promised land for us!
It is done! Done it is!
I shall follow thou!
We have attained salvation!
Thou and we are united in paradise!
We abide by thy divine will!
Blessed are the slumbering ones!
Thou hast heeded my call! Heeded my call!
Speak with Robin
(Approach Robin)

speaker: Black Swan
line: Here we are.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ (It's... Robin?)

text: (Talk to Robin)

speaker: Robin
line: Finally, you've arrived.

speaker: Acheron
line: Let me introduce you to Robin. She woke up from Ena's Dream by her own will, and it's this tough lady who led us here with her song.

speaker: Robin
line: I woke up for the same reason as all of you. In the dream, I experienced something that could never occur in reality...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Small Town Grotesque 2.mp4

speaker: Robin
line: Are we going to lock it up in a cage? I want to see it fly freely in the sky.

speaker: Sunday
line: Without us, this bird would be too fragile to survive on its own. Do you want it to die?

speaker: Robin
line: No, but...

speaker: Sunday
line: Then let's take care of it together until it can return to the sky.

speaker: Robin
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Sunday
line: Birds have wings because they're meant to fly. Even if they may crash on the ground one day, they shouldn't be trapped in a cage.

speaker: Sunday
line: Birds belong to the sky, so we should help them return there, right?

speaker: Robin
line: ...The illusion was so impossibly blissful that I realized it was just a dream.

speaker: Robin
line: And this is our final hope. Ena's Dream is founded upon the Harmonious Choir , namely everyone's shared wishes. It will only materialize once the aspirations of all beings in Penacony merge as one.

speaker: Robin
line: At present, it has become impervious due to people's desire to remain slumbering within the dream. And in order to destroy it...

speaker: Robin
line: We must make everyone in Penacony want to wake up .

speaker: Black Swan
line: Now comes the tricky part. How do we do it?

text: I'm curious, too.
That doesn't sound simple at all...
Maybe we should just go back to Ena's Dream?

children.speaker: Black Swan
children.line: You want to go back? Unfortunately, human consciousness always gravitates toward reality. Now that you've seen the flaw in the dream, there is no turning back.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Humans' yearning for sweet illusions borders on obsession, leading them to subconsciously resist... the harsh reality.

speaker: Black Swan
line: â–¶ Therefore, I carefully selected a moment where (Trailblazer) was completely unguarded, guiding ( him / her ) to uncover the truth ( himself / herself ) to make ( him / her ) regain ( his / her ) consciousness.

speaker: Black Swan
line: However, to wake up everyone in Penacony and get them to share the same determination... that would be nearly impossible.

speaker: Acheron
line: Indeed. I'm afraid it's almost as difficult as resurrecting an Aeon...

text: (BoothillandDan Hengwalk towards the group)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But we can't just stay here and do nothing.

speaker: Boothill
line: This is a critical moment for the whole universe! Who cares about some dumb number?

text: You've woken up, too?
Well, well, well, someone enjoys making a dramatic entrance.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Thanks to Black Swan.

speaker: Black Swan
line: You're welcome. And thanks to the Memokeepers in Penacony, too. I believe your partners... have also awakened from their dreams.

speaker: Acheron
line: This is the first step of our plan. With the assistance from the Garden of Recollection, those who possess a strong will, like you, will gradually awaken from the dream. These free wills are the "discord" that will sway Ena's Dream.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: However, awakening a mere handful of individuals is insignificant compared to the vast number of people immersed in the dream. We must find other ways to awaken the free will of millions of people within a short period of time.

speaker: Acheron
line: If breaking through from the inside proves challenging, we can seek assistance from the outside. We've long been aware of a potential solution.

speaker: Acheron
line: Asdana is a galaxy known for its abundant memoria and the remarkable phenomenon known as Synesthesia Dreamscape. When people first enter this place, they often find themselves and others sharing a collective dream...

speaker: Acheron
line: At this very moment, there is only one dream encompassing the entire Asdana system.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So you mean, if we can attract a large number of outsiders to this system, their free will would intertwine with this dream and shake it to its core...

speaker: Black Swan
line: However, those outsiders might also succumb to the dream and become the foundation of the Order instead. The real challenge is â€” How can we gather a huge number of people as determined as you within a short period of time?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like the Jade Abacus of Allying Oath will be the only solution.

speaker: Boothill
line: ...No, no need for that.

speaker: Boothill
line: Keep your once-in-a-lifetime treasure. We don't need to bother the Xianzhou Alliance for such a tiny request. You want thousands of people with unwavering free will? Hah, that's easy...

speaker: Boothill
line: Just leave it to us Galaxy Rangers .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You can gather Galaxy Rangers?

speaker: Boothill
line: Hah! Outsiders may see Galaxy Rangers as elusive and disconnected individuals, and actually... they're right! And that's why we have a tacit understanding among us...

speaker: Boothill
line: Do you know what it is, Acheron?

speaker: Acheron
line: It's the relic I returned to you.

speaker: Boothill
line: Exactly. Its owner must have told you that it's meaningless to anyone other than a Galaxy Ranger, and that it can only fulfill its purpose when returned to its rightful owner.

speaker: Boothill
line: Because it's a burial artifact, worthy only of a hero who has served the Galaxy Rangers with honor. When its light illuminates the universe, it means the fall of a hero, and in the direction it falls...

speaker: Boothill
line: Countless meteors will streak across the sky. Those "meteors" are Galaxy Rangers coming from all corners of the Cosmos, driven by a shared purpose, without questioning the cause or counting the cost. Because we abide by a bottom line...

speaker: Boothill
line: The shooting stars of The Hunt only descend on the longest night, and with them... comes the dawn.

speaker: Boothill
line: We've stayed silent for far too long. Now, it's time to remind all the cowards, oppressors, and villains of the universe of our presence! I'll be the one to ignite the first spark.

speaker: Robin
line: Once the Dreamscape is swayed, I'll complete the second step. I'll fine-tune the slumbering souls with the song of the Harmony, interrupting them with the discord of " Trailblaze " and guiding them towards reality.

speaker: Robin
line: It's true that some people are born strong, and others are born weak. If the Trailblaze is the target of heroes, then the Harmony will guarantee that the strong help the weak. Only the people of Penacony themselves can be the saviors of their homeland.

speaker: Robin
line: Their path of happiness should be forged by themselves. While I may not be a Nameless, I'm willing to instill courage in all those who need it.

speaker: Robin
line: This includes my brother as well. Ena's Dream... is too cruel for him, and everyone else.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Your plan sounds well-conceived, but still, it appears somewhat... idealistic and romantic. The flaws rooted in human nature can't be eradicated overnight. Do you believe these efforts alone are enough to convince everyone to choose the right path?

speaker: Acheron
line: I agree with you, Black Swan. That's why the most critical aspect of this plan is not to convince everyone to choose the right path...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...But to inspire them to save themselves.

speaker: Black Swan
line: So, you're the key in the end, I assume?

speaker: Acheron
line: The Harmonious Choir possesses the power of an Emanator. To overcome it, you'll need the same level of power. The final step in destroying the sweet dream... will be my responsibility.

speaker: Black Swan
line: That's a relief to hear.

speaker: Boothill
line: Now that our roles are assigned, let's get to our battlefields and pose a grand finale!

speaker: Acheron
line: â–¶ May I have a moment alone with you, (Trailblazer)? There's one more thing I need to explain to you.

speaker: Acheron
line: This grand festival is drawing to its close. This is the starting point for the ultimate stage of our journey... just as it marked the beginning of all the stories in Penacony.

text: Whatever we're facing, I'm prepared.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: I have faith in you. However, before we depart, there is one more thing I must tell you.

text: This is where Firefly uncovered the truth.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Indeed, she was the first to discover the world beyond the shores of "death" and shared this truth with all of us.

text: Your words still carry... a profound significance.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Only by reflecting on our steps can we remember the path we should be walking on... and the companions who have walked alongside us.

speaker: Acheron
line: There's something you should know. We were able to locate you within this boundless dream and find the key to breaking free from the dream, all because of one person's unwavering dedication...

speaker: Acheron
line: Firefly. She awakened from the dream ahead of others, discovered the Express amidst the stars, and brought us valuable information about the remnants of the Order. She may have been aided by the script, and it came at a cost...

speaker: Acheron
line: As you know, Firefly is a stowaway who entered the Dreamscape in a different way from ours. Without the dreampool in the hotel or assistance from The Family , she can only awaken from this dream in one way... a real "death."

speaker: Acheron
line: We mustn't fail her determination. I'm not implying that we must win this fight no matter what, but our resolve should match that of the courageous lady.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...Are you ready?

text: Let's embark on the final stage.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Very well. Now, please close your eyes...

children.text: (Proceed toAnd on the Eighth Day (Domain of Excursion))

text: I'm not quite ready yet...

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: That's alright. Take your time to contemplate this moment. Once you feel ready, let's step onto the final stage.

text: Speak with Acheron and return to the stage

title: Step Description
content: Everything is in place... It is time to return to the stage for the final encore that will jolt the world awake.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission And on the Eighth Day 1.mp4

line: How long... has this rain been ongoing?

speaker: Acheron
line: If I remember correctly, it has lasted for decades, or even centuries.

speaker: Acheron
line: The unwavering determination of The Hunt followers persists even in death, but thankfully... we've guided those lost souls to their lives beyond. They were heroes in their time, and they won't be reduced to puppets of the Nihility in their death.

speaker: Acheron
line: You see, the shadows on the sea have vanished. Do you remember? You once said that the sky would clear when the regrets of the departed had faded away.
But it's still raining...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...I know.
So, why is all this...?
Why did this rain choose me?

speaker: Acheron
line: Because someone's regrets haven't been fulfilled, perhaps.

speaker: Acheron
line: Mortals who walk the Paths are like sailors on a vast ocean, leaving behind a trail that creates countless ripples of possibilities. These ripples last longer than the fleeting lifetimes of humans.

speaker: Acheron
line: And for some, their presence leaves such a strong mark that it's reflected in the waves.

speaker: Acheron
line: Sin Thirsters ... the obsessions of the Pathstriders. They emerge from the depths of IX , seeing themselves as masters of their own destiny, unknowingly repeating the actions of their past lives.

speaker: Acheron
line: They emerge from the Nihility and head toward it, leading purposeless lives. However, these hollow phantoms...

speaker: Acheron
line: They have journeyed with me for such a long time.
So, this is how it is.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission And on the Eighth Day 2.mp4

line: I... I'm already dead.

speaker: Acheron
line: ...Yes.
Are you watching over me?

speaker: Acheron
line: This is my duty... as the watcher of the Acheron.

speaker: Acheron
line: I'm guarding the path to the abyss of the Nihility, guiding every soul reluctant to become one with it... back to this side.
But if this is what the departed ones expected, should you try to change it?

speaker: Acheron
line: I don't know, but someone once told me that when the inevitable moment came, he hoped that...

speaker: Acheron
line: Someone would stand at his grave and place a bouquet of flowers.
Even if... it doesn't make sense at all?

speaker: Acheron
line: Some tasks have to be done, even if they are pointless. I have... experienced that much already.

speaker: Acheron
line: Please extend your hand, and then close your eyes.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission And on the Eighth Day 3.mp4

speaker: Acheron
line: I'll carry your wish with me and fulfill it. Only then will I be able to put an end to the final regret by the Dead Sea.
Will I... ever see them again?

speaker: Acheron
line: Yes â€” that is certain.

speaker: Acheron
line: Because it was you who told me about the Express, your two former companions, the expedition cut short by the Swarm , your narrow escape from death, and your encounter with the Galaxy Rangers...

speaker: Acheron
line: And Penacony, the hometown to which you could never return.
Yeah, for countless times... I got rejected by The Family and had to pass it by.
But I knew that my companion was still there... alone...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Mikhail ... Are you still there...?

speaker: Acheron
line: Take my hand and come with me. We... will leave this place.

speaker: Acheron
line: You'll embark on a long, long journey, shrouded in darkness. But fear not, as a touch of red will be awaiting you at the end of the path.

speaker: Acheron
line: That's the color of "existence." Follow it, and it'll guide you and illuminate the way out. By doing so, you'll eventually reunite in the warmth of the sunlight.

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Thank you...

speaker: Acheron
line: May death be the end of your boundless dream...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...guiding you back to the waking world.

text: Say your final farewells to Acheron

title: Step Description
content: The golden dream is about to become restless.In the long night that will follow, I fear that you may encounter countless setbacks and witness endless tragedies. In the end, only black and white will be left in your vision.But you must have faith. That black-and-white world will have a fleeting moment of crimson. But, when you make your decision......It will appear once again.And you, you must carefully ruminate on its meaning, then return to the waking world.We will find our answer there.

speaker: Acheron
line: Welcome to Horizon of Existence ...

speaker: Acheron
line: This place is one of the thousands of manifestations belonging to the sleeping and shapeless , and it's also an exit out of the Nihility for the awake ones.

speaker: Acheron
line: Let's bid our final farewells here.

text: (While walking)

speaker: Sparkle
line: Always distinguish between reality and imagination... alright, Gray?

speaker: Black Swan
line: "Life is akin to a winding labyrinth, where memories serve as our sole companions."

speaker: Aventurine
line: May your schemes... be forever concealed.

speaker: Robin
line: Ena's Dream... is too cruel for him, and everyone else.

speaker: Gallagher
line: To the imperfect tomorrow.

speaker: Firefly
line: I still remember the question on the invitation letter â€” Why does life slumber?

text: (Approach Acheron)

speaker: Acheron
line: Why does life slumber...? We don't know the answer yet, but we're about to awaken from this dream.

speaker: Acheron
line: Or perhaps, such is the answer itself.

speaker: Acheron
line: Leave this place, return to where you belong, and... awaken Penacony from this dream.

text: Will you come with us?
What if folks don't wanna wake up?
Will I get to witness your hidden power?

speaker: Acheron
line: As I said, our plan is not about convincing everyone to choose the right path, but about inspiring them to save themselves. So, when will people actively save themselves?

speaker: Acheron
line: The answer is... when they are in desperate situations.

speaker: Acheron
line: Like a drowning individual in the deep sea, when one's body and mind bear immense pressure, agony, confusion, and despair will follow. I firmly believe that...

speaker: Acheron
line: The fragility of humankind often freezes them in their tracks, but in truly desperate situations they will strive to save themselves. And now... Penacony has enough heroes to lead them forward.

speaker: Acheron
line: It's through this inherent self-centered instinct that people exert their utmost effort, even when they know their struggle is fruitless. As absurd as it may seem, it's their resistance.

speaker: Acheron
line: â–¶ As for now, (Trailblazer)... It is time to guide them, not as a savior, but as a Nameless among those mortals.

speaker: Acheron
line: In this way, you will reunite in the warmth of the sunlight.

speaker: Acheron
line: The rain... is intensifying. Before we part ways, please allow me to ask a few final questions.

speaker: Acheron
line: So far, you have forged unbreakable bonds with numerous individuals and entities in the sweet dream.

speaker: Acheron
line: Might I ask if you fear severing these bonds with your own hands?

text: I feel no fear.

speaker: Acheron
line: If there is a vast, lifelike dreamland that is virtually indistinguishable from reality... a realm without death, where everyone can attain the happiness and fulfillment they deserve, living blissfully ever after.

speaker: Acheron
line: I would ask â€” Would you wish to stay?

text: I would never ever want to live in a dream.

speaker: Acheron
line: Imagine if this splendid dream were fated to fall apart: Friends, family, strangers... followed by the gentle breeze, soaring birds, the stars... and ultimately, yourself.

speaker: Acheron
line: Everyone, and every face they remember, the joy and the heartaches, the vows sealed and those left hanging... all will inevitably march towards a predetermined ending. If you had grasped the journey's finale right from its inception...

speaker: Acheron
line: I would ask â€” Would you still embark on this journey?

text: I would blaze a trail without hesitation.

speaker: Acheron
line: I'm glad. The answer itself doesn't matter. What matters is that you've made a decision.

speaker: Acheron
line: Listen, touch, and ponder, and therein lies the sensation. Cherish it, because that's what makes us exist. Such is the only answer humans can offer when facing the Nihility.

speaker: Acheron
line: If the Nihility represents the primal fear of life, rendering any lofty convictions insignificant under THEIR imposing shadow...

speaker: Acheron
line: Then behind this shadow, there must exist the most fervent source of light in the world.

speaker: Acheron
line: Just as every life that edges closer to death fervently approaches the end of the Nihility...

speaker: Acheron
line: We must pursue that primordial light.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission And on the Eighth Day 3.mp4

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Now come to think that you exist in the Nihility, and you watch over others to depart it...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Such a task is absurd and meaningless.

speaker: Acheron
line: Nevertheless, someone has to do it. As for the meaning you mentioned...

speaker: Acheron
line: Even if it's a meaningless task, I've come this far, haven't I?

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Even if the future you forge may not even belong to you?

speaker: Acheron
line: It may not belong to me, but it definitely belongs to someone.

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: What hardships you must have experienced...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: In that case, allow me to do something meaningless, too...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Please tell me your name.

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: Perhaps my existence will vanish in the next moment... and nobody will remember this conversation or your answer...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: But I believe... that your name should be remembered...

speaker: "Tiernan"
line: And this universe... will remember it as well.

speaker: Acheron
line: For me, some things are difficult to recall, yet there are others... that I find challenging to forget.

speaker: Acheron
line: Such is "memory," a creation of the past that blossoms into significance in the distant future.

speaker: Acheron
line: I remember that marks the start of my journey, the origin of the vibrant red hue in my life, and the most fervent element amidst every tempest...

speaker: Acheron
line: That's my name...

speaker: Acheron
line: Raiden Bosenmori Mei.

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: The golden dream is getting restless.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: In the coming long night, I'm afraid you will face many setbacks and witness many tragedies.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: And in the end, you will only see in black and white.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: But please believe me that in that monochrome world, there will be a glimpse of fleeting red, and when you make a choice...

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: ...it will appear once more.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: What you must do, is ponder its significance, then return to the waking world.

children.speaker: Acheron & (Trailblazer)
children.line: That's where we all find our answers.

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Enter battle with"Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: ...Have you broken free from the dream of Order?

speaker: March 7th
line: We've done enough sleeping already, let's show them a wake-up call!

text: (During Accelerando)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: Without Order, how can the weak be righteous?

text: (During Volteggiando)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: If you have any objection, feel free to make your case...

text: (After the beginning of phase two)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: With 107,336 notes, I solemnly invite you to join the glorious chorus â€” and ascend to the heavens!

text: (During Accelerando)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: If the Dreamscape is indistinguishable from reality, can it still be called an illusion?

text: (During Tempestoso)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: With this perfect melody I command â€” recreate paradise anew!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: ...Music?

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: There seems to be another kind of sound coming into the Order's symphony...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Penacony's first, and last, disharmony.

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Continue battle with"Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus)
(While using Horizon's Echo From Afar for the first time)

speaker: Welt
line: Those imprisoned in their dreams are awakening for Freedom.

text: (After using Horizon's Echo From Afar for the first time)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: Robin, is that you singing...?

speaker: Robin
line: Brother, you have heard their cries... This is not the paradise they hoped for.

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: Even so, they don't know where they should be heading. That's why... I had to become the lone star in the sky to guide them.

speaker: Robin
line: Even if that star... must hang in a perpetual night of solitude?

text: (While using Horizon's Echo From Afar subsequent times, random)

speaker: Robin
line: Brother... The weakness of humanity cannot be redeemed by others.

speaker: March 7th
line: Even if the future is full of pain... we won't escape from it!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You have a noble soul... Don't be shackled by the past!

speaker: Himeko
line: Witness... the will of the weak!

text: (After the end of phase two)

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: If we had never experienced solitude, how could we have embarked on different paths?

speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
line: Now, our final talk has concluded.

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: All the work of creation has been completed.

children.speaker: Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: The inevitable day has arrived...

children.speaker: Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: The Embryo of Philosophy...

children.speaker: Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: will reshape for us all of reality!

text: (Cutscene ends)
(Continue battle with"Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday)

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: If your "paradise" can save more people, sever my path with your hands.

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 1)
On the first day, grant Truth...
(When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 2)
On the second day, grant the Calendar...

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: O, fallen Aeon... may I honor you.

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 3)
On the third day, grant Language...
(When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 4)
On the fourth day, grant Value...

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: With this seven-day vow, I command you to heed my summon.

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 5)
On the fifth day, grant Rules...

speaker: March 7th
line: Uh oh, I have a bad feeling about this!

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 6)
On the sixth day, grant Meaning...

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: It was not you who created all things.

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 7)
On the seventh day, grant Dignity... About to witness Im Anfang war die Tat!

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: It was humanity that created you!

text: (During Im Anfang war die Tat)

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: ...Your divine being will become the foundation of our paradise!

text: (When Im Anfang war die Kraft reaches turn 1 again)

speaker: "Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday
line: By the solemn desire for Order...

speaker: Robin
line: Stop it... You want to achieve the paradise we promised, but the Order is not the only choice!

speaker: Robin
line: True happiness and the meaning of life lie in defying the Nihility and embracing all that life offers!

text:
(After defeating"Embryo of Philosophy" Sunday)
(Cutsceneplays)

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: So... Why does life slumber?

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: Because... someday...

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: We will wake from our dreams!

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: The night is still... too short...

children.speaker: Robin
children.line: Brother...

children.speaker: Robin
children.line: The dream... is over.

text: (Cutscene ends)
â–¶ In the first year of the AE 2158, a fiery conspiracy erupted in the Land of the Dreams, but soon faded in chaos and destruction.

â–¶ Whispers carried the tale of those fateful 48 system hours, when a sun teetered on the precipice of collapse, a paradise stood on the brink of destruction, and a world was poised to surrender to its new master. Amidst it all, a body decayed, a pack of vultures gathered, and a brother and sister were doomed for long separation.

â–¶ And so, an Aeon succumbed to slumber once more. Some celebrated this fall, while others mourned. Among the insignificant witnesses, mere specks in the vast tapestry of the universe, it was said that this time, the Aeon met THEIR demise with dignity.

â–¶ As the Cosmos bathed in the radiance of a pure dawn, a tempestuous storm brewed on the horizon. The chant of "Everything for the Amber Lord" grew ever louder. Yet, no matter how one contemplates it, time inexorably swings Qlipoth 's colossal hammer in eternal cycles.
â–¶ The tale of the Astral Express reaches both its conclusion and a new beginning. Time marches forward, heralding the arrival of a new chapter in the history of Trailblazing expeditions.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Brother, do you think... the stars will fade away?

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: Where did that come all of a sudden?

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Because the constellation that looks like a bird, the... Torrent Eagles... looks a bit dim lately.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: It's the Torment Eagles. Don't worry, it's still there. It's just it's located in the inner ring of Penacony and can only be seen when spring and summer overlap.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: As for the question you asked... I think stars do die, just like people.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: But do you know, sister? No star actually belongs to the present. The light we see from them is from a long time ago.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: Even after the stars perish, their light will travel millions of light-years, spanning countless years, to illuminate the night sky of another world.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: In our paradise, I believe there will be a star like that, shining with the same light. Its radiance will last "forever," and its name... will be "happiness."

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: No, not just one star! We should have two stars... or maybe even more!

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: Yeah, you're right.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: It's a deal!

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: It's a deal, then. This is our promise, and nothing will sway our ideals.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Yeah, you bet!

text: (Credits roll)

Penacony, Land of the Dreams The End Honkai: Star Rail Lead Actors (Trailblazer) Starring Dan Heng as Dan Heng ??? as March 7th Himeko as Himeko Joachim Nokianvirtanen as Welt Yang Firefly as Firefly, SAM Raiden Bosenmori Mei as Acheron Black Swan as Black Swan Kakavasha as Aventurine Mikhail Char Legwork as Misha, Watchmaker Penacony as Gallagher Boothill as Boothill Sparkle as Sparkle Veritas Ratio as Dr. Ratio Robin as Robin Sunday as Sunday "Dreammaster" as Sunday's Servant Gopher Wood as "Dreammaster" Cameo Appearances Silver Wolf Sampo Topaz and Jade Argenti Script Supervisor Elio In Loving Memory Razalina Jane Estella An ex-surveyor aboard the Astral Express and a young scholar, brimming with enthusiasm and curiosity. Hailing from the Zorina-Urd system â€” enlightened by Remembrance and dominated by academic cliques â€” she majored in memoria dynamics. To seek out broader academic possibilities, she joined the crew of the Astral Express to build Asdana and launched her research into memoria. Towards the end of the War of Independence, she piloted a shuttle on her own and disappeared into the Memory Zone in search of secrets about the Primordial Dreamscape. Her research results formed the theoretical basis for the development of the entire Penacony to this day, creating a profound impact on the affluence of later generations. She was the true founder behind the Land of the Dreams. Breukelen Tiernan The former guard of the Astral Express and an outstanding gunslinger. Hailing from the frontier world of Frati, his worship of local legend Oakley the Musketeer saw him board the Astral Express. During the war, he was one of Penacony's most accomplished generals and the sole winner of the Fanghunter Medal â€” an award conferred by Hanunue himself. While reopening the silver rail with the Lampmoth Family during the civil war, he was ambushed by the Swarm and disappeared only to be rescued by the Galaxy Rangers. He fought in the crusade against Lord Ravager Zulo and managed to survive that gruesome battle, then disappeared out of sight completely. That was until the day a Self-Annihilator found his relics. Truly, he was a pure, noble, and selfless warrior. Mikhail Char Legwork Former mechanic of the Astral Express, and the legendary big shot of Penacony, "the Watchmaker." Hailing from the oceanic planet of Lushaka , he was adopted by legendary seafarers, the Mikhail-Char couple. It was just by happenstance that he boarded the Express, making many travel companions along the way while contributing greatly to the prosperity and development of Penacony. Beyond mechanical repairs, he often humbly claimed to possess few skills, except for his knack for spinning tales. "The Watchmaker" was his greatest lie of all, and Penacony's "Festivities" was his final lie. He did not want his star to deviate from the path of freedom, so he intended to cleverly employ falsehoods and keep various Paths existing here for a long time. But he was unable to witness Penacony's end. He died a quiet death in a forgotten corner somewhere, with only a handful in attendance at his funeral. In line with the Nameless' tradition, his Crew ticket was returned to the starry seas. Meanwhile, Penacony remains resplendent in its glory, and the child's dream will continue in perpetuity. May This Journey Lead Us Starward
(Return to reality)

speaker: Jade
line: It's a pleasure to hear your voice again. Congratulations, you've become the... biggest winner of this festival.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Are you just calling to poke fun at me?

speaker: Jade
line: No, I'm just impressed. Not only did you venture alone into Penacony and discover the truth of Dreamflux Reef , but you also managed to escape with the help of that Knight of Beauty ...

speaker: Jade
line: Remember the recording you received from your Trailblaze friend? It's now the most valuable chip in this game.

speaker: Jade
line: However, this came at a high cost... Losing a Cornerstone is a hefty price to pay. Diamond just called a meeting to discuss what to do with you.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Just as I expected. So, is Diamond planning to demote me, or kick me out of the Ten Stonehearts ?

speaker: Jade
line: Why don't you take a wild guess?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Well, alright. Then I'll guess... he's going to promote me to P46?

speaker: Jade
line: Alright, what will you wager?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Are we talking about an actual bet here? I don't wanna wager anything just so that you can swindle it all in the end.

speaker: Aventurine
line: But if it's just a friendly bet, I'll put on the line what I did when we first met. I'll bet my life, ma'am.

speaker: Jade
line: Interesting. But since it's Diamond's call, no one can predict the outcome.

speaker: Jade
line: I'm on my way to Penacony. Once everyone is settled, we'll return to Pier Point for the final showdown.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Sounds like I'll be out of the action for a while. Finally, a chance to kick back and relax?

speaker: Jade
line: Yeah, leave everything to me and Topaz, child. Thanks to you, as soon as the Jade Stone was delivered to The Family's compound, we finished up our preparations.

speaker: Jade
line: The seeds we planted have taken root. Soon... it'll be time to "reap" the rewards.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Let's wrap it up for now. Looks like I've got a visitor here...

speaker: Aventurine
line: Oh? So many surprises today. Didn't expect a Galaxy Ranger and wanted criminal to show up here...

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...One who managed to take out two IPC members under the noses of our fleet. Do you understand what that means?

speaker: Boothill
line: Screwubbaboo, I just put them to sleep! Don't try to intimidate me with that nonsense. Besides, I've taken down more IPC lackeys than the residual value you've squeezed, and I don't mind adding a few more zeroes to my wanted poster.

text: (Boothill points his revolver at Aventurine)

speaker: Boothill
line: I have a question for you. Be honest now, or I won't think twice about puttin' a bullet in your fudgin' head.

speaker: Boothill
line: Tell me... Where is Oswaldo Schneider ?

text: To be continued...

(Teleports to the guest room inThe Reverie (Reality))

(Mission complete)
